From head (8,7), all four adjacent cells are occupied this turn: up (8,8) and down (8,6) by your own body, left (7,7) by enemy body, right (9,7) by your own body. No safe move exists this turn.

LEFT

0.rationale:
My head is surrounded by my own body segments, but each of those segments will move forward this turn, vacating their current cells. None of the four cardinal directions leads outside the board or into another snake’s head.  

- Moving **UP** or **DOWN** would place me on cells currently occupied by my body, but those cells will be vacated; however they keep me at the same x‑coordinate and do not bring me closer to any reachable apple.  
- Moving **LEFT** would head straight back into the segment directly behind me, which is effectively moving backwards and is discouraged.  
- Moving **RIGHT** continues my forward momentum, shifts my head to (7, 8), a cell that will be freed by the body segment currently there, and moves me eastward toward apples at (8, 0) and (6, 3). It also avoids any imminent head‑on collision with the nearest enemy snake, which is likely to move left toward (7, 7).  

Thus the safest and most strategic choice is to continue moving east.

RIGHT
